At 09:54 AM 3/4/2003 -0800, Tung Wai Yip wrote:

>I may simulate the error condition by throwing my own SQLException, such as
>adding some
>
>   if (testExceptionFlag)
>     throw new SQLException("test the error handler");
>
>But this would add clutter to the code. Mock object seems cleaner. However,
>ResultSet is a large interface to implement. Also the ResultSet object used is
>not created by me but by .executeQuery() so I have no control on what 
>object it
>creates.

What you want to mock is probably the statement and connection, not the 
result set (since you never need the result set to throw an 
exception).  This should be easier to implement, but also check out 
http://www.mockobjects.com/, which may do much of that work for you.

-Kathy
